metadata.title: CVE-2023-23000 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.17, drivers/phy/tegra/xusb.c mishandles thetegra_xusb_find_port_node return value. Callers expect NULL in the errorcase, but an error pointer is used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23000` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-28-generic-64k - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1020-azure - 5.19.0-1020.21~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1017-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1017.18~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1017-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1017.18~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.0.0-1006-oem - 6.0.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1004-oem - 6.1.0-1004.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.

linux-xilinx-zynqmp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
